Headlines:: A flash strike against AbeBooks, which began Monday, is a rare concerted action by vendors against any part of Amazon, which wields huge power in the book world.
Last week the company was praised for increasing what it paid its warehouse workers. Now the company is explaining what that means for bonuses and stock grants.
Don’t fall for a bundle blunder.
Amazon executives faced protesters during several hours of heated testimony before the New York City Council over a deal the company received to put an office in Queens.
As a company owned by the world’s richest man prepares to transform Long Island City, tenants of the Queensbridge Houses worry that they’ll be left behind.
The creators of a fairy-tale action film expand it into an eight-episode series by removing the fairy tale.
JBG Smith is the largest landowner in a Virginia area some have called a ghost town. That could change fast with Amazon’s new office plans.
The company reported a net income of $2.9 billion in the third quarter, partly by being more efficient in its warehouses and data centers.
After meeting with the governor and mayor, Amazon decided the men could put aside their differences, and it began to iron out a package worth over a billion dollars.
How the company and local officials flesh out plans for the new corporate presence will be crucial to the economic lift it produces.
